accessibility.text: Solution: Use “Chained CPI which uses a basket that changes from month to month
We do not calculate the CPI correctly: Substitution Bias
Solution: Use “Chained CPI which uses a basket that changes from month to month
Because items and quantities in the basket are fixed, the CPI does not account for substitutions consumers do in response to higher prices
We do not calculate the CPI correctly: Substitution Bias
Solution: Use “Chained CPI which uses a basket that changes from month to month
Because items and quantities in the basket are fixed, the CPI does not account for substitutions consumers do in response to higher prices
We do not calculate the CPI correctly: Substitution Bias
Cause of this mistake: CPI uses old quantities with new price
Solution: Use “Chained CPI which uses a basket that changes from month to month
Solution: Instead of updating the basket every 10 years (as it’s done now) update the quantities in the basket more often
